newsitem.title: INDIA: REPORT ON INDIA'S STERLITE IN 2-3 DAYS.
newsitem.headline: REPORT ON INDIA'S STERLITE IN 2-3 DAYS.

text.p: The government of Tamil Nadu state said on Saturday that a committee investigating a suspected gas leak from Sterlite Industries (India) Ltd's copper smelter will soon release its report.
"We plan to publicise the report of the expert committee in two or three days," Tamil Nadu chief minister M. Karunanidhi told reporters in the state capital Madras.
Karunanidhi said officials in the southern state would decide later whether to reopen the smelter.
Last month, Sterlite was asked to close down operations after suspected gas emissions. More than 100 workers in a nearby factory were reportedly taken to hospital.
The company strongly has denied any leak.
The state government set up an expert committee to examine the emissions. Karunanidhi said the government would take a decision only after receiving a detailed report from the committee.
Sterlite operates India's only private-sector copper smelter with an annual capacity of 100,000 tonnes. The smelter began operations in December 1996.
Company officials have said that the closure was costing the company 25 million rupees ($700,000) a day. ($1=35.7 rupees)
